attributes.action: Legislate so children can get hot meals free during school holidays
attributes.background: Children on free school meals are not able to access food 170 days a year during school holidays and are going hungry

attributes.action: Force social media to verify its members more throughly to help stop bullying.
attributes.background: Bullying on social media is out of control. It's so easy for someone to say hurtful things, to someone else online that would otherwise been deemed unacceptable in person. These comments are demoralising, hurtful and depressing and are often said without any thoughts of the person they're aimed at.
attributes.additional_details:
Social media needs to offer more protection, help and support to its young, old, vulnerable and genuine members. Banning a troll member is not enough, as they can easily setup another account with a email address and start trolling again. 
Social media needs to verify new members more throughly with debt / credit or electoral register info and ban for life those intent on causing harm to others. Encourage members to take more responsibility for their comments by showing they are a real person.

attributes.action: Review Police policies instantly rejecting candidates with visible tattoos
attributes.background: Current policies for recruitment within the force is to completely reject candidates, regardless the level of application, if the person has visible tattoos irrespective of their nature.They are looking to diversify by employing new recruits from different cultures but are contradicting that message
attributes.additional_details: Its worrying that people are being judged on appearance and not ability, if the tattoos are non offensive. Statistics show that in 2015 approximately one in 5 uk people have tattoos, this figure set to rise dramatically by 2025. Peoples attitudes to tattoos are changing and if the Home Office don't look at altering the current policies they are not only restricting good quality candidates but could find that police may be excluding themselves from certain communities within their jurisdiction.

attributes.action: Withhold aid from countries, such as Uganda, where homosexuality is a crime.
attributes.background: In many countries LGBT people suffer persecution simply for being what they are. They are disowned by their families and suffer death threats from relatives. They have no protection in law, instead police harass them and arrest them. They are in continual danger of prosecution and imprisonment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Pakistan

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Nigeria

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Uganda

attributes.action: Allow GCSE Science Students Data Sheets with Ions, Equations & Reactivity Series
attributes.background: The outgoing GCSE Science Specifications include a 'Data Sheet' which consists of very important information for candidates, such as ions. It would be a disadvantage for Reformed GCSE students to not be given said information; especially considering that the new qualifications are more challenging.
attributes.additional_details: In GCSE Chemistry, a sheet with ionic formulae and the Reactivity Series of Some Common Metals is given. In GCSE Physics, a sheet consisting of all mathematical equations is also given. It would be a gross disadvantage for Reformed GCSE students to not be given said information; especially considering that the reformed qualifications are more challenging for individuals taking the examinations in Year 11 and without such sheets, comparison between Legacy and Incumbent qualifications is difficult.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to allow children under the age of 16 to have their body pierced
attributes.background:
I was watching a child cry out of fear and pain in a store which allows children to get there ears pierced. Yes the parents gave consent to it, but the child defiantly didn't know what was going on, watching this really upset me.

I think the law needs to be stricter on piercings in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Despite many piercing salons imposing their own age restrictions for body piercings, there is no legal age restriction for any kind of piercing in England and Wales, unlike in Scotland, where people under 16 are required to have a parent’s permission before having ears and other body parts pierced.

attributes.action: Retiring UK Soldiers should be fast tracked/prioritised jobs within the police.
attributes.background: Our retiring Soldiers have protected us and our country for hundreds of years with little or no return when they come back to civilian life. They need structure and purpose while they become readjusted to working and living away from the Forces. Intelligence/strength/pride Would win the war on crime
attributes.additional_details: Our police force has become disrespected by the communities they serve. This is in part of lowering standards of our once great police force. The passing fitness test is a joke, once passed They have just 30 minutes a week to spend on fitness so there is no surprise their not up to the high standards they should be! So fast track retiring military into the police, people who are fit, strong, intelligent, think on their feet and who have worked in dangerous environments all their lives.

attributes.action: Allow small businesses to have the same consumer rights as an individual.
attributes.background: Small businesses are being targeted by larger businesses to unfair contract terms, outrageous drop out penalties/clauses & higher prices. Yet, because we are a small business we have little or no consumer protection. Help make this change and allow a fairer marketplace for small business consumers.

attributes.action: Get a ban for killing animals for people to eat.
attributes.background: While watching 'Babe' my 6 year old Myla burst into tears while the pigs were being taken to the slaughterhouse and said "this has to stop, mum start a petition to get it stopped". So here we are giving it my best go. Please make a massive change in this world and a little girl happy by signing.

attributes.action: Ensure that the triple lock on the Basic State Pension is removed.
attributes.background:
The triple lock is a guarantee to increase the state pension by a minimum of 2.5% a year. 

Guaranteed rises in the state pension worsen generational inequality.
attributes.additional_details: With the EU Referendum in mind it is more important than ever that we are all affected equally by our economic policy decisions.

attributes.action: Legalisation of Medical and Medicinal cannabis, in the United Kindom.
attributes.background: Report by Adam Smith Institute says UK’s drug strategy ‘has failed in its core aims’ and urges government to legalise cannabis
attributes.additional_details:
Cannabis should be legalised in the UK, according to a report that has the backing of several cross-party MPs including the former deputy prime minister Nick Clegg.

Current cannabis policy in Britain is a “messy patchwork” of legislation intermittently enforced by regional police and an embarrassment, says the report by the free-market thinktank the Adam Smith Institute.

attributes.action: Focus a larger portion of the defence budget on service personel.
attributes.background: Early terminations from the armed forces is at an all time high. The priorities of the chain of comand are certainly proportionally aimed at staff retention. However new legislation brought by the Army2020, such as, the planned scrapping of the commitment bonus scheme contradicts this completely.
attributes.additional_details: Other plans such as the increase in prices for SFA to bring it into line with the private housing market are evidence of the mindless eradication of the few remaining factors that keep todays service men and women HAPPY to remain in the services. Pensions, pay, accommodation cost, catering contracts, SFA standards, the CarillionAmey contract for the MoD estate. ALL of these points need addressing in order to provide the level of retention the army needs to function.

attributes.action: Assaults on emergency personnel the same penalty as assaulting a police officer
attributes.background: Members of the emergency services are being assaulted. This should not be tolerated and should be felt with as severely as Assaulting a Police Officer. This type of abuse must be severely dealt with.
attributes.additional_details: Having known personnel in the emergency service and hearing they are abused nearly everyday.  We have a duty to support them like they do us, when we need them to save our lives.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for street lights to utilize motion sensors to turn them on.
attributes.background: I believe that there is no need for street lights to be turned on when they are not in use. This is a waste of energy. My solution for this is to make it mandatory for street lights to incorporate motion sensors to activate them, therefore will only be turned on when they will be utilized.

attributes.action: Provide funding to migrate all NHS systems from Windows XP for security reasons
attributes.background: Barts NHS trust has just been hit with a ransomware attack, it was running Windows XP. 30 percent of all NHS trusts have been hit by ransomware according to an FOI request by Sentinel One. Moving off Windows XP is efficient, Imperial College NHS Trust found they cut help desk calls by 60 percent.
attributes.additional_details:
Upgrade from Windows XP would be a good start but proper endpoint security is needed to protect against ransomware. Dynamic endpoint protection and DNS level filtering. Anti malware and anti exploit protection is also necessary. 
http://www.computing.co.uk/ctg/news/3002565/barts-nhs-trust-windows-xp-pcs-infected-with-suspected-ransomware 
http://www.dclsearch.com/nhs-trusts-a-magnet-for-ransomware-foi-disclosures-reveal-it-security-news/ 
http://www.theregister.co.uk/2017/01/17/nhs_ransomware/

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for any councillor to fail to pay council tax.
attributes.background: As a lawyer and council tax payer I read of an increasing number of councillors who fail to pay their council tax and this problem cannot be allowed to continue

attributes.action: Reduce the Overseas Aid Budget from 0.7% of GDP to 0.6% of GDP.
attributes.background: The UK Overseas Aid Budget at 0.71% is the 5th highest of all European countries.   I suggest that it is reduced to 0.6% and that the cash difference be invested in our NHS.   The reduction amounts to approximately £1.4bn p.a.and so would fund the increasing needs of the NHS on an annual need.
attributes.additional_details:
With increasing demands on the NHS through an ageing and increasing population, the NHS needs more money.   We spend 8.5% of GDP (based on 2015 data) against an average in Europe of 8.9% and are the 10th highest spender of 10 listed countries.   We are the 5th higher contributor to Overseas Aid of 10 listed countries.  Germany & France spend considerably less on Overseas Aid than the UK - but considerably more on their NHS.  
Sources:  Wikepedia & Kings Fund

attributes.action: Support cycling as a vital part of Transport strategy with a National Plan
attributes.background:
The Transport Secretary recently doored a cyclist and later gave the impression that he thought cyclists were not road users. 
Cyclists are seen as demons and victims on the road.
attributes.additional_details: It is time this stopped and government promoted cycling as part of the future for Transport: healthy, clean, and efficient with a small footprint.

attributes.action: Senior Ministers should be available to mainstream media during crises...
attributes.background:
With self-evident crises (like the NHS or Southern Rail) the Minister with that brief should be directly answerable. 
I have lost count of the number of times I've heard phrases like 'we asked for a comment but no one was available.'
attributes.additional_details:
Clearly we don't need to interrogate Ministers on their shoes or their trousers (leather or not) - this would be petty. 
When something serious is unfolding, however, they should be immediately available and answerable.
Some Ministers (eg Jeremy Hunt) seem to see their job as some kind of sinecure: not good enough. 
We don't need written statements - they can't be interrogated. Nor a junior sacrificial lamb (eg Chris Philp). We need the Minister with overall responsibility.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of hard wired electrical accessories to the general public.
attributes.background: Many house fires and potentially dangeous situations regarding the electeical installations in dwellings are caused by poor workmanship on electrical installations. The main reason for this is due to the availability of hard wired accessories to the general public, who then fit them themselves
attributes.additional_details: Many people will not touch the plumbing in thier house due to the possibility of a leak thus causing damage, but will happily tamper with the electrical installation of their own homes and sometimes others as they believe they know what they are doing but in reality, do not have the slightest clue and are totally incompetent to touch such systems. These people are putting peoples lives at risk everyday and are able to do so as anybody can purchase the equipment without proof of competence to fit

attributes.action: Make it law for drivers to slow down and move over when they see roadworkers
attributes.background: every year a number of recovery operators and roadside technicians and other roadworkers are killed because of people not giving enough room when we are working on motorways. when they see flashing orange beacons slow down and move over to the middle lane to give us enough room to work safely

attributes.action: Public enquiry:Investigate state of prisons. Bring British Army in to help staff
attributes.background: Prison staff are unable to cope with the safe running of our prisons. Staff and inmates safety must be priority. Promises of more staff have not been fulfilled. More training is needed for prison roles. Health and safety practice is poor. Begin a public enquiry. In the meantime; bring in our Army.
attributes.additional_details: Inmates rehabilitation is not to the standards that they could be. Inmates need guidance. The ratio of inmates per staff member is unreasonable. Thus, staff suffer and potentially risk their safety. Prison staff are over-worked and not paid enough in light of the work that they undertake. Inmates are often not in receipt of adequate care. The lack of rehabilitation of offenders affects all parts of our society. It is time to stop ignoring inmates and staff members needs.

attributes.action: Make audio recording in meetings about children and vunerable adults mandatory.
attributes.background:
Children, vulnerable adults and their carers are suffering. 
I am concerned about neglect, lying and professional backwatching in schools and care services. All meetings should be audio recorded and a copy given to those discussed, their carer and all attendees.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.communitycare.co.uk/2015/12/10/parents-allowed-record-child-protection-meetings/

Producing copies of an audio recording for all involved in meetings within the care/education system would reduce abusive behaviour, unprofessionalism, lying, inaccuracies and would help to stop recordings taken out of context and placed on social media.
No more hiding behind 'their word against ours'. Let's have proper transparency when it comes to our children's wellbeing and protecting our vulnerable.

attributes.action: Make Universal Credit an optional benefit.
attributes.background: Many people will find they get less under Universal Credit than they would have done under one of the previous benefits that it replaces. While Universal Credit has a transfer top up amount up amount this will not do anything to help new claimants out in the future.
attributes.additional_details: Therefor it would be reasonable to request that the government does NOT make Universal Credit the only option by allowing people to choose either Universal Credit or the benefits that apply to them out of the 6 benefits that Universal Credit replaces.

attributes.action: Stop Network Rail removing lineside trees for their own commercial gain.
attributes.background: Recently a residential area within Stirling received generic letters for Network Rail advising that from 26th November 2016 they were going to be removing trees and plants from their lineside. They advised this was to minimise the risk of disrupting railway operations.
attributes.additional_details: This proposed action is completely unjustified and un-proportionate. They have not considered the impact on the environment, wildlife and the effect it will have for local residents. The letter states that they will be removing trees,plants and vegetation unto 10 meters from their lineside, this will in effect create a concrete jungle and damage the beautiful aesthetics of Stirling. This must be opposed and stopped as the impact of this is far greater than the commercial gain of a company.

attributes.action: Don't take prosecution powers away from RSPCA, give them more powers.
attributes.background: The Environment, Food and Rural Affairs Committee wants the Government to take away private prosecution rights for the RSPCA. Instead of taking away powers, we should be delivering the RSPCA more rights to be able to seize without Police needing to be present.
attributes.additional_details:
The RSPCA has a 92% conviction rate for cases that they take to the courts, this is more than the CPS.

The Environment Food and Rural Affairs Committee want prosecutions given to the CPS instead.

The RSPCA should have more rights to take animals rather than having to wait 24 hours, or calling the Police as animals could be going through torment whilst waiting for the RSPCA to return.

For emergencies that the Police call them too, they should be given some form of emergency lighting as it can take them hours to arrive.

attributes.action: Change of Law: MPs must stand down after serving a constituency for 10 years.
attributes.background: Nearly 10% of current UK MPs have been active for over 25 years. Nearly 20% of MPs have been active for over 20 years. The world has changed vastly since 1996, yet nearly 1/5 of MPs have been serving since then. Excessive continuous service prevents real political change for the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The Rt Hon. Sir Gerald Kaufman, The Rt Hon. Kenneth Clarke, The Rt Hon. Michael Meacher & Dennis Skinner have been active since 1970 - nearly 37 years making decisions for our country. The term 'Father of the House' is unsettling. We should be a progressive country, not a frozen one. Change is healthy. Fresh ideas and fresh actions are needed now more than ever.

attributes.action: Set a time limit of 2 weeks on JSA and ESA decisions to reduce claimants' stress
attributes.background: The film "I, Daniel Blake" gave a vivid and true-to-life description of the possible consequences of long delays waiting for official decisions from the Job Centre et al. The system appears designed to grind down claimants, and cause the greatest hardship. The current system is cruel and degrading.

attributes.action: Make Marcus Jones review his choice to turn down the funding for mk homeless
attributes.background: Over the last year we have had three of our homeless die on the streets.. There are also people living in  Substandard temporary accommodation in and out of the city. Please review your decision to turn down funding that would of helped these people the government have forgotten
attributes.additional_details:
We have over 500 family's that are homeless... This money would of helped the local authority to provide 50 units to help home these people the gvmt have forgotten... 
People are dying on our streets.. 
Marcus Jones please fully review your decision. 
And give us an answer as to why you turned down the application! 

Thank you

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to close St Bart's Hospital, Rochester, Kent.
attributes.background: There is a lack of provisions in the Medway Towns as it is and we need this hospital. It was used as a rehab hospital for stroke patients and anyone else who needed a longer stay in the hospital. Medway Maritime Hospital will only allow people to stay short term as they need the beds.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a brief history of the hospital; this is one of the oldest hospitals in Britain, having been founded in 1078 by Gundulph, Bishop of Rochester, for the "poor and leprous". The current hospital building in New Road, Rochester was built in 1861.  The hospital relied on charity donations until 1948 when it was funded by the NHS.

We don't want this historic building to end up in the wrong hands because they may demolish this gothic style building and a piece of Medway history will be gone!

attributes.action: Change the way Tax Credits are calculated to stop overpayments
attributes.background:
Tax credits are state benefits that provide extra money to people responsible for children, disabled workers and other workers on lower incomes.
Have you ever had an over payment for Tax Credits even though you advised them straight away of your change of circumstances as they asked? read on..
attributes.additional_details:
Have you ever received an over payment for Tax Credits?
This is because HMRC calculate your entitlement over a 12 month period they predict that your situation will remain the same for these 12 months, so if you then change your circumstances more than likely you will get an over payment usually in the £100's.
I suggest they calculate it weekly or monthly and remain the same each week/month unless we advise them of any changes and hopefully see over payments £10-30 instead of putting us in debt.

attributes.action: Allow Ambulances with a patient on board the right to use bus lanes any time.
attributes.background: As Ambulance crew it is very frustrating to have to sit in a endless queue of traffic with a patient on board who although may not be in a life threatening condition may be distressed or in pain while a empty bus lane is available. If empty Taxis and solo mopeds can use them then why not a Ambulance

attributes.action: Ban the use of loud fireworks in residential areas
attributes.background: Many animals find fireworks scary. It is estimated that 45 per cent of dogs and other animals in the UK show signs of fear when they hear fireworks (RSPCA). This can include toileting indoors, shaking, barking and crying. Fireworks should not be used in a residential area to avoid animal distress.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks should not be allowed in residential areas, and should only be allowed in a licensed settings on set days, not days or weeks before/after the event.

attributes.action: 1p and 2p coins should be removed from circulation (cash transactions only)
attributes.background:
We the undersigned want to see the 1p and 2p pieces removed from circulation, since they are no longer of a useful value.

Over time, due to inflation, the value of a coin decreases. The one and two penny pieces are now worth so little that we cannot buy anything useful with them.
attributes.additional_details:
It is important to clarify that this petition is not asking for ALL transactions to be rounded to the nearest 5p. This petition only applies to cash. It calls for removal of 1p and 2p coins, therefore any cash transaction would result in change given rounded to the nearest 5p.

Examples
- If I were to use cash to buy a bottle of milk costing 99p, I would receive no change, since 1p rounds down to zero.

- If I were to buy a cake costing 96p, I would receive 5p change, because 4p rounds up to 5p.

attributes.action: Stop advancement of religion being considered a charitable purpose.
attributes.background: The law recognises the advancement of religion as a charitable purpose. Religion includes all faiths and none  it includes a religion that does not have a belief in God. Advancing any belief system alone should not be considered charitable activity.
attributes.additional_details: Some belief systems may help people but assessing whether the beliefs themselves achieve benefit is subjective.  Public money through gift aid should not be available for this. Religious organisations should have to show other public benefit to qualify as charity and should only be allowed to use public money for that other purpose.

attributes.action: Bring back the paper tax disc.
attributes.background: Bring back the paper tax disc, as you can view the tax disc on your screen and can be seen, that you have a tax disc and have the tax, as people are not paying the tax, as well all the tax should go towards the up keep of the road only and not to be used with other tax.
attributes.additional_details: The DVLA hasn't done enough to tell people when they need to pay. When your tax is due, you get a reminder letter, but this is not enough for thousands of people, who forget their renewal date, and can face a fine of up to £1,000.

attributes.action: Cap young drivers' insurance at £1200
attributes.background: More and more young drivers are taking the roads hour by hour day by day and the last thing they want to see is an insurance quote ranging from £1500 to as much as £4500 - young drivers can't afford this amount of money just to be able to drive so if we cap it at £1200 it is a more reasonable price.

attributes.action: Protect those being bullied in our schools by lowering the age of responsibility
attributes.background:
Lower the age to protect children and young people who suffer horrific injuries at the hands of bullies.
I had my arm broken 14 years ago by bullies, so this isn't stopping happening to others! 
Recently 7 year old Jak had his head bashed into a metal pole, leaving him with a horrific head injury.
attributes.additional_details: http://metro.co.uk/2017/04/09/mum-shares-picture-of-son-7-after-bullies-pushed-him-into-metal-pole-6563641/

attributes.action: Change the law to make any MP who changes allegiance from one party to resign
attributes.background: Any MP or councillor can charge party allegiance with no thought to the electors who voted for them when they stood for a particular party, when chaging party they no longer represent the thoughts of those who elected them.  They should be made to resign and face a new election.

attributes.action: Air-drop Reactive Skin Decontamination Lotion (RSDL) to Idlib, Syria.
attributes.background: With the use of drones, immediate assistance can be provided by dropping these RSDL kits to civilians and hospitals in and around the Khan Sheikhoun area as continued strikes against their facilities has made treating patients incredibly difficult.
attributes.additional_details:
Sarin gas has the potential to end a life within ten minutes of exposure. This is because once this chemical finds its way into the body it manipulates neurotransmission activity by making the body act against itself. This may lead to convulsions, paralysis, and death. Some of it indicators are pupil constriction, blurry vision, and chest tightening. This lotion specifically counteracts the effects of chemical warfare by blocking the skin from absorbing deadly chemicals.  

Taking immediate and effective action now and distributing these kits across this region and other conflict zones in Syria may then disincentivise the carrying out of chemical attacks again.

attributes.action: Stop paying child benefit/ tax credit to children NOT living in the UK.
attributes.background:
A Conservative Party pledge to stop British taxpayers’ money being sent to the families of EU migrants across the continent looks like it will be broken.

The Times report that EU migrants will still be able to receive child benefits even for families who have never even set foot in Britain .
attributes.additional_details: http://www.westmonster.com/tories-to-break-promise-on-benefits-for-eu-migrants/

attributes.action: Allow blood transfusion recipients to donate blood and bone marrow
attributes.background: Currently, those who have received a blood transfusion since January 1980 are not permitted to donate blood or bone marrow, due to fears of vCJD transmission.
attributes.additional_details: At the time of the ban, 1 transfusion recipient was suspected, not proved,  of developing vCJD due to donor blood contamination. An estimated 52,000 people were prevented from donating by the ban. At a time when blood and bone marrow donors are dangerously low, it is patently ridiculous to deny life-saving supplies based on the tiny chance of recipients developing CJD decades later. Either the ban should be lifted, or at risk donors should  assessed on a case by case basis.

attributes.action: Regulate amateur performance requirements.
attributes.background: Many councils do not know what exactly is required in regards to the documentation to put on an amateur performance. These amateur performers do not get paid. We want the law simplified for Amateur performers to be able to perform for their families without all the ever changing regulations.
attributes.additional_details: As qualified and experienced dance teachers we understand the importance of keeping our students safe but in many cases what is now required of a dance/performing arts school is excessive. We currently have 2540 signatures on our change.org petition. The law needs to be changed before we all stop putting on performances which will have an effect on local theatres and our businesses. Help us small business owners to put our students on stage and regulate the requirements across the country.

attributes.action: Stop Corby Urgent Care Centre (8-8) Closure
attributes.background:
Corby Urgent Care Centre (8-8) is said to be closing.

This will cause disruption not to only the community but other health services also! 

Please sign!  DON'T CLOSE OUR 8-8 service!

attributes.action: Make Companies Responsible For Travel Costs After Public Transport Has Stopped.
attributes.background: Members of staff in many companies and businesses spend a large amount of their wages on travel home after hours, businesses and companies should take responsibilty for travel costs for their employees after hours (and on bank holiday's, opens, weekends etc.)
attributes.additional_details: Companies and businesses do not take into consideration the struggle of students, open/close staff, members of staff who live a far distance from work etc. And should been forced to pay travel costs.

attributes.action: Allow Liverpool/Merseyside to have a referendum on independence.
attributes.background: Liverpool and its people have always felt disconnected from the rest of the country especially the south, I would like the government to look into the possibility of giving us a independence referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Many people in Liverpool feel apart from the rest of the country, this is well known.

attributes.action: Ban male circumcision for under-16s on non-medical grounds
attributes.background: Circumcision has many consequences including loss of nearly 20,000 nerve endings, decreased sexual sensitivity, can lead to infections and even death. Most supposed benefits of this procedure have been proven to be myths. In some cases, males are circumcised at 8 days of age and without anaesthetic.
attributes.additional_details: The age of consent to any form of sexual activity is 16 in the UK. Circumcision will heavily affect the sex lives of any males, why should parents have the right to mutilate the penis without the child being of sound age or mind to give permission, as after all it is his body that will be changed. If changed, it allows males to be able to make a responsible decision on whether they wish to be circumcised and means a child doesn't suffer pain from such operation for unnecessary reasons.

attributes.action: Bring the National Insurance system in-line with that of Income Tax
attributes.background: The weekly amount of pay after which all employees have to start paying National Insurance contributions has not been increased in line with the 'headline-grabbing' increases to the Personal Allowance for Income tax and represents a major penalty to business, especially those who employ themselves.
attributes.additional_details:
The 'Primary Earnings Threshold' (weekly earnings) for commencement of National Insurance contributions has increased by an amount of just £16 since 2011/12; an increase of just over 10%. https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/516787/Table-a4.pdf 
The Personal Allowance for Income Tax from over the same time to 2017/18, by contrast, represents an increase of over 50%.
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/516769/Table-a1.pdf

attributes.action: Reverse share dividend tax hike.
attributes.background: How can the conservative Government make tax breaks on shares look very attractive, encouraging the public buy them in April 2016. Then change the rules after the share prices have plunged due to Brexit. #very wrong

attributes.action: Enforce the law that makes placing tart cards in public telephones illegal.
attributes.background: Tart cards are the cards that advertise prostitution services, which are often found in public telephones. The placing of these advertisements was made illegal by the Criminal Justice and Police Act of 2001, in Section 46. However, it seems as if nothing is being done to enforce this law.
attributes.additional_details: Every day on many public telephones the sexually explicit pictures can be found in abundance. Numerous studies have revealed how looking at such images damages the brain. It is not acceptable that our children and youth are exposed to these images in public places and that the perpetrators are not brought to justice. It is a primary duty of government to protect its citizens, and that includes protecting children from explicit images in public places. This law must be enforced with more vigour.
